title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial jury selection scheduled for November 18, aiming to conclude by Christmas.
Cellphone evidence from ex-Trooper Proctor's phone preserved for Walshe's defense amid larger legal disputes.
Defense cites mental, physical impacts from jail assault affecting Walshe's participation in trial preparation.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Star Market over Mass. Pike reopened after a three-day closure due to an asbestos scare.
Newton Health Department closed the store after asbestos was potentially released during stockroom demolition work.
MassDEP confirmed asbestos was contained; no air or surface samples in the store detected asbestos.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace to score 57 goals this season for the Boston Bruins, showcasing an impressive goal-scoring ability.
Geekie recorded a 95.68 mph shot on goal, the fastest this NHL season, scoring in six consecutive games for the Bruins.
Despite skepticism about sustaining his scoring rate, Geekie's role in the power play and shooting accuracy boost his potential.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: The Celtics exercised a $2.74 million team option on Baylor Scheierman for the 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman, drafted 30th overall in 2024, averaged 8.5 minutes and 3 points per game this season.
Known for his shooting in college, his NBA impact has been limited, but Boston values his playmaking skills.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots traded Keion White and a seventh-round pick to the 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
White struggled to fit in the Patriots' defensive scheme and his playing time diminished significantly this season.
The 49ers believe White has 'limitless potential' and see him fitting well in their defensive strategy.

title: Save money during New England travel in November
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Bluebird Talta Lodge in Stowe offers a Black Friday discount on bookings this November.
Newport Restaurant Week offers fixed-price menus from Nov. 7-16, with lunch and dinner deals.
MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 offer free service in Boston through Feb. 28, 2026.

title: On the Cape and Islands, a new housing fix is gaining traction
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local leaders in Cape and the Islands push for real estate transfer fees to address affordable housing shortages.
The proposed transfer fees could be 0.5% to 4% on home sales above $1 million, funding local housing projects.
Opposition from real estate groups concerns potential increased homeownership costs and reduced market activity.

title: Meet the vampire who went viral during a visit to Salem
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Matthew Pruno, a Long Island cosplayer, gained viral fame after his vampire cosplay was shared on a Salem Facebook group.
Pruno's follower count surged over 15,000 across various social media platforms after returning from a weekend in Salem.
Pruno, known for cosplaying Louis from 'Interview with a Vampire', plans to attend next year's Endless Night Salem event.

title: Boston history quiz: How much do you remember from the past 30 years?
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston.com marks its 30th anniversary with a quiz on major events in Boston history since 1995.
Readers are invited to test their memory by placing historical Boston events in correct chronological order.
Kelly Chan produces multimedia content for Boston.com, engaging readers with interactive games and quizzes.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for November 2025
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'Back to the Future,' 'Frances Ha,' and 'Game Night' starting November 1.
The Queue highlights Massachusetts-based Halloween movie picks like 'Hocus Pocus' and 'The Witch.'
Boston.com staff recommends 'Nobody Wants This' Season 2 and 'Hereditary' for streaming.
